items.headline: The AI hype is starting to fade on Wall Street. Here’s what investors need to know.
items.summary_en: It might not seem like much based on the action in markets, but doubts about the durability of the artificial-intelligence trade were having a moment on Wall Street this week.
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: I inherited $600K in Apple stock. It now makes up 50% of my portfolio. Is that too risky?
items.summary_en: “I worry that a downturn in the tech sector, or something Apple-specific, could wipe out half my portfolio.”

items.headline: Recession seems far off — that’s the good news. Yet the economy is also far from trouble-free.
items.summary_en: Enough trouble spots emerged in the U.S. economy to coax the Federal Reserve to cut interest rates last week — but it turns out the news isn’t all that bad.

items.headline: I’m retiring at 63 with $1.5 million saved. Is 70/30 equities/bonds too risky?

items.headline: Many crypto-treasury companies are trading for less than what their digital assets are worth. Is this a bargain or a big red flag?
items.summary_en: As more companies with a crypto-treasury strategy have seen the premium of their shares to their crypto holdings narrow — or even turn into a discount — some investors are wondering whether now is a good time to buy in.

items.headline: The AI trade increasingly hinges on OpenAI — and that’s a big risk for the entire market
